meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #2710.

td.p: Joe Gurski, a junior from Roselle, New Jersey (subtotal of $0)
Amanda Goad, a junior from Richmond, Virginia (subtotal of $11,000)
Derek Bridges, a junior from Greensburg, Pennsylvania (subtotal of $14,600)

tr.td: THE FAR EAST
SOFT DRINKS
ODD WORDS
ETIQUETTE
LAST NAME'S THE SAME

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: So we are going to set a record this year. You\'re going to wind up with $24,800, Joe, for a third-place finish--but we have a tie between Derek and Amanda, and we will have one question to break that tie. The first player to ring in with a correct response will be the champion. Now Amanda, it\'s obvious that you and Derek are going home with the same amount of money. However, the winner--the Teen champion--gets to come back to compete in our $100,000 Tournament of Champions, so there is a great deal at stake for the two of you. The tiebreaker category today is...)
DerekWhat is Don Quixote?
$8,000
AmandaWhat is Don Quixote?
$10,000
JoeWhat is Don Quixote?
$12,400
Don Quixote')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'Published in 1605, the first part of this novel was dedicated to the Duque de Bejar, Marques de Gibraleon...')

tr.td: FAMOUS NOVELS
Published in 1605, the first part of this novel was dedicated to the Duque de Bejar, Marques de Gibraleon...
